author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister and National Conference working president Omar Abdullah on Tuesday expressed apprehensions over the delay in government formation in the State.

In an open letter, which appeared on NDTV, a New Delhi-based television channel, Mr. Abdullah said: “The people of the State cannot be expected to wait for you to make up your mind. Taking over now is not a sign of being power-hungry; but not taking over is certainly an abuse of the trust the people placed in you and your party.”

‘Disservice to people’

The former Chief Minister called the delay the “biggest disservice to the people of the Jammu and Kashmir.” The State has been under Governor’s rule since January 9, after Chief Minister Mufti Muhammad Sayeed died on January 7.
title: Abuse of people’s trust, says Omar
